result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber Annella Oium was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Amber Annella Oium is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Amber Annella Oium was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Amber Annella Oium was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 3, 4 and 5.
Defendant to report to Probation today October 23, 2015.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file.
DNA surcharge.

-Defendant to maintain current mental health treatment including all appointments and medications.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Random and regular testing.
-Court authorizes Chemical Dependency Assessment.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-MRT is up to the discretion of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Credit for time served.
Defendant will be released today January 31, 2017.
Court will convert remainder of fines/costs into a civil judgment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Francis Xavier Rivard DF: Amber Annella Oium appeared. Case called at 8:12. Includes 14CF106, 14TR543, 14TR544, 14TR545. ADA Hartung believes there is an agreement. Atty. Rivard agrees.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 1 and amended count 2 to DC in14CF106. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 and amended count 2 to DC in 14CF106. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses without objection Ct 3,4,5 in14CF106 and 14TR543, 14TR544, 14TR545. Court orders a PSI to be completed by10-16-2015. Bond continues in form and amount.
